intro: Clibadium surinamense var. asperum, commonly known as the rough sida, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its fibrous roots and robust growth make it adaptable to various environmental conditions. The species is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in soil stabilization and potential medicinal properties.
